intro: Rumex turcestanicus, commonly known as the Turcestan sorrel, is a flowering plant species native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its basal leaves that are broadly triangular with a prominent midrib and a hairy surface. It produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in the spring. The species is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils.
